title: CSF.1
text: The student will
subject: Computer Science
subs: compare the structures, functions, and interactions between application software, system software, and hardware; and
explore the relationship between hardware and software using the Internet of Things.

title: CSF.2
text: The student will model how information is broken down into smaller pieces, transmitted as packets through multiple devices over networks and the Internet, and reassembled at the destination.
subject: Computer Science

title: CSF.3
text: The student will explain the role of protocols in transmitting data across networks and the Internet.
subject: Computer Science

title: CSF.4
text: The student will evaluate the scalability and reliability of networks, by describing the relationship between routers, switches, servers, topology, and addressing.
subject: Computer Science

title: CSF.5
text: The student will identify and explain ways that sensitive data (assets) can be threatened by malware and other computer attacks, using appropriate terminology.
subject: Computer Science

title: CSF.6
text: The student will give examples of ways to protect sensitive data (assets) from malware and other computer attacks and evaluate them according to multiple criteria.
subject: Computer Science

title: CSF.7
text: The student will explain typical tradeoffs between usability and security and recommend security measures in a given scenario based on these (or other) tradeoffs.
subject: Computer Science

title: CSF.8
text: The student will write or adapt a program to validate its input and to avoid certain kinds of vulnerabilities.
subject: Computer Science

title: CSF.9
text: The student will evaluate the tradeoffs in how data elements are organized and where data is stored.
subject: Computer Science

title: CSF.10
text: The student will create interactive data visualizations using software tools to help others better understand real-world phenomena.
subject: Computer Science

title: CSF.11
text: The student will use data analysis tools and techniques to identify patterns in data representing complex systems.
subject: Computer Science

title: CSF.12
text: The student will develop a program working individually and in teams using a text- based language.
subject: Computer Science

title: CSF.13
text: The student will identify the expected output of a program given a problem and some input.
subject: Computer Science

title: CSF.14
text: The student will design and iteratively develop programs for practical intent or personal expression, incorporating feedback from users.
subject: Computer Science

title: CSF.15
text: The student will design and implement algorithms using
subject: Computer Science

title: CSF.16
text: The student will implement a program that accepts input values, stores them in appropriately named variables, and produces output.
subject: Computer Science

title: CSF.17
text: The student will trace the execution of an algorithm, illustrating output and changes in values of named variables.
subject: Computer Science

title: CSF.18
text: The student will apply the basic operations used with numeric and non-numeric data types in developing programs.
subject: Computer Science

title: CSF.19
text: The student will use predefined functions to simplify the solution of a complex problem.
subject: Computer Science

title: CSF.20
text: The student will apply simple algorithms to a collection of data.
subject: Computer Science

title: CSF.21
text: The student will create programs
subject: Computer Science
subs: demonstrating an understanding that program development is an ongoing process that requires adjusting and debugging along the way; and
using version control to create and refine programs.

title: CSF.22
text: The student will use tools and methods for collaboration on a project to increase connectivity of people in different cultures and career fields.
subject: Computer Science

title: CSF.23
text: The student will evaluate the ways computing impacts personal, ethical, social, economic, and cultural practices.
subject: Computer Science

title: CSF.24
text: The student will explain the beneficial and harmful effects that intellectual property laws can have on innovation, including the impact of open source software.
subject: Computer Science

title: CSF.25
text: The student will explain the privacy concerns related to the collection and generation of data through automated processes that are not always evident to users.
subject: Computer Science
